Description: Lentoid flask with two vertical handles, core-formed: a monochrome flask in a translucent pale white-green glass. The wide vertical handles are of the same fabric as the body. A black and white diagonal twist cord encircles the rim. The surface was originally glossy but is now partly filmed. One handle broken. Assembled with small section of body missing.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: ‘Masterpieces of Glass, The British Museum’ (London 1968), no. 5; B. Nolte, ‘Die Glasgefässe in Alten Ägypten (Berlin 1968), 132, pl. XXVI, 33.
Bibliographic references: Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (fig.28, pp.32-33)
